general.description: RNumber is an arbitrary-length integer class. While the main implementation is in C++, bindings exist for C, Perl, and Bigloo. What differentiates RNumber from many other examples of arbitrary-sized integers is that a given number object has a fixed size. This makes it suitable for modeling hardware resources such as registers. However, the size may be modified if necessary, making it more flexible than some other implementations, such as SystemC.
general.customers: Raptor and Figleaf are the primary customers, though other users also exist.

implementation.structure:
The source code layout is similar to most autoconf/automake libaries:
Implementation code and private headers are found in the src directory.
Public headers are found in the include directory.
Autoconf macros are found in the macros directory.
Regression tests are located in the tests directory.

revisioncontrol.p: RNumber uses CVS for revision control.

implementation.buildenv:
RNumber requires:
gcc 2.95.3 or gcc 3.x.
automake and autoconf (if building from CVS).
swig (if building the Perl bindings).
Perl 5.6 or higher.
To build:
Check the project out from cvs: cvs checkout tlv/rnumber
Run autoconf/automake: ./autogen.sh --prefix=[install prefix] [other options]
Build it: make
Run the regression: make check
Install it: make install
If you are doing development and do not want all of the headers installed, even if they have not changed, you can use the command make cinstall. This will only install header files that are newer than the existing installed ones, or have not yet been installed.

test.testplan: The testplan is quite simple: If a new feature is added, add a test in the regression.
test.regression: The regression is located in the tests directory and contains a test for each major feature in the library. To run the regression, simply issue the command make check.

swprocess.documentation: Currently, the main source of documentation is this file and the rnumber header files.

release.location: RNumber is released into /cad/tools/rnumber on the Armada network and /_TOOLS_/dist/moto-sd610-rnumber- on the GAIN network.
release.dependencies: RNumber only depends upon gcc's libstdc++.
release.releaseprocess: To release rnumber, follow the standard procedure for releasing a library into /cad or /_TOOLS_. You may also use the cadinstall tool, which will do this all for you.
release.bugreporting: DDTS is used as the bug-reporting software.
